excerpt: Listen, if Jesus does not physically return to this earth, he is not the Messiah. He must return to planet earth, but as we turn our microscope in further, he must return to the nation of Israel.
notes: Directly links Jesus’ messianic identity to biblical prophecy and physical fulfillment.

excerpt: It is a fact, biblically, spiritually, that there's a greater world behind the material world, spiritually, whatever we see materially, behind that world is a spiritual realm that is far deeper, far greater and far more powerful.
notes: Stresses the unseen spiritual reality as the true context for Christian life.

excerpt: Saul, King Saul, had lost the spiritual perspective of things. He had four years now been very carnal...And God wanted to use Saul. But Saul, in his constant rebellion against God, in the Old Testament economy, God gave him up.
notes: Illustrates the peril of acting carnally and neglecting God’s leading.

excerpt: We know this by now that any man, any woman who is driven and controlled by their emotions will make horrible, whimsical, capricious decisions all the days of their lives until they can get rooted and grounded and wait upon God.
notes: Warns against the consequences of unchecked emotionalism instead of spiritual maturity.

excerpt: God will give a gift as the book of Romans says, he bestows a ministry, a gift upon someone, and he says, I give that gift, I give that ministry, and I give it in such a way that I don't take it back. That's a scary thing. Because if you and I walk around judging somebody's ministry by how big the church is...Listen, we could be deceived.
notes: Challenges the assumption that visible success or gifts signal authentic spiritual standing.
